feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk Valleys... Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in the northwest Interior since Monday, with the heaviest amounts in the upper Kobuk and Upper Noatak Valleys. Expect rivers in the Noatak and Kobuk Valleys to see significant rises through the weekend. Flooding is not expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia Monday night and moving over the Northern Bering Sea and Southern Chukchi Sea Tuesday will bring south winds of 25 to 35 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday and Wednesday. This will cause elevated surf from the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 27 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall over the past few days. * WHERE...Escatawpa River and Earlville in northwest Mobile County. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 4:39AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flow in Tonto Creek has increased above Action Stage which will make unbridged crossings unsafe to cross. * WHERE...A portion of east central Arizona, including the following county, Gila. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM MST.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 6 feet with a high risk of dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Monica Mountains

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:42AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy dense fog early this morning... Patchy dense fog has developed across portions of southern New Jersey and the Delmarva. Local visibility may drop to one quarter mile or below. When driving early this morning, use caution and be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities, use low beams, and slow down.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:55AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Areas of Dense Valley Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog are found in the valleys of eastern Kentucky. The thickest fog will result in visibilities below a quarter of a mile. Motorists should slow down and allow extra time to reach their destination this morning.
